requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
requirements.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL define the minimum change history information to be stored for resolving possible disputes regarding registration.
requirements.searchText: reg_18 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall define the minimum change history information to be stored for resolving possible disputes regarding registration.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL approve a PID Provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its PID Provider Registry. To that end, a Member State SHALL define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of PID Providers in its Registry.
requirements.searchText: reg_19 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall approve a pid provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its pid provider registry. to that end, a member state shall define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of pid providers in its registry.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL identify PID Providers at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent PID Provider could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
requirements.searchText: reg_20 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify pid providers at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent pid provider could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
requirements.specification: A Registrar SHALL provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered PID Provider.
requirements.searchText: reg_20a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered pid provider.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
requirements.specification: A Registrar SHALL have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered PID Provider, which SHALL specify that a PID Provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the PID Provider or of a competent national authority.
requirements.searchText: reg_20b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered pid provider, which shall specify that a pid provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the pid provider or of a competent national authority.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL approve an Attestation Provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its Attestation Provider Registry. To that end, a Member State SHALL define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of Attestation Providers in its Registry. These processes and rules SHOULD consider any relevant differences between QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers.
requirements.searchText: reg_21 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall approve an attestation provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its attestation provider registry. to that end, a member state shall define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of attestation providers in its registry. these processes and rules should consider any relevant differences between qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL identify Attestation Providers (i.e., QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers and non-qualified EAA Providers) at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent Attestation Provider could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
requirements.searchText: reg_22 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify attestation providers (i.e., qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers and non-qualified eaa providers) at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent attestation provider could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: A Registrar SHALL provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered Attestation Provider.
requirements.searchText: reg_22a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered attestation provider.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: A Registrar SHALL have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered Attestation Provider, which SHALL specify that an Attestation Provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the Attestation Provider or of a competent national authority.
requirements.searchText: reg_22b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered attestation provider, which shall specify that an attestation provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the attestation provider or of a competent national authority.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL enable a Relying Party to register remotely, using an API or user interface.
requirements.searchText: reg_24 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall enable a relying party to register remotely, using an api or user interface.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL identify a Relying Party at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent Relying Party could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
requirements.searchText: reg_25 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify a relying party at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent relying party could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: With respect to Reg_25, a Member State SHALL consider whether a registering entity intends to act as an intermediary.
requirements.notes: According to the [European Digital Identity Regulation], an intermediary is a Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: reg_26 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties with respect to reg_25, a member state shall consider whether a registering entity intends to act as an intermediary. according to the [european digital identity regulation], an intermediary is a relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: A Member State SHALL have a policy for the cancellation of a registered Relying Party, which SHALL specify that a Relying Party is cancelled at least on request of the Relying Party or of a competent national authority.
requirements.searchText: reg_29 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall have a policy for the cancellation of a registered relying party, which shall specify that a relying party is cancelled at least on request of the relying party or of a competent national authority.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
requirements.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an access certificate contains a name for the PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, in a format suitable for presenting to a User.
requirements.searchText: reg_31 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate contains a name for the pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, in a format suitable for presenting to a user.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
requirements.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an access certificate contains an EU-wide unique identifier for the PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, and SHALL specify a method for deriving such identifiers.
requirements.notes: a) The EU-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a composition of a unique identifier of the Registrar, defined in the policy, and a unique identifier for the Relying Party allocated by this Registrar. b) This Relying Party identifier is identical in all access certificates issued to a given entity.
requirements.searchText: reg_32 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate contains an eu-wide unique identifier for the pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, and shall specify a method for deriving such identifiers. a) the eu-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a composition of a unique identifier of the registrar, defined in the policy, and a unique identifier for the relying party allocated by this registrar. b) this relying party identifier is identical in all access certificates issued to a given entity.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: The Commission SHALL provide a technical specification establishing a common Certificate Policy for registration certificates, covering at least management and selection of signing keys, revocation and lifecycle management of registration certificates on individual intended use level.
requirements.notes: The technical specification may require the Provider of registration certificates to follow applicable parts of technical standards such as EN 319 401 (for General Policy Requirements for TSPs) and TS 119 461 (for identity proofing of Relying Party representatives).
requirements.searchText: rprc_01 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the commission shall provide a technical specification establishing a common certificate policy for registration certificates, covering at least management and selection of signing keys, revocation and lifecycle management of registration certificates on individual intended use level. the technical specification may require the provider of registration certificates to follow applicable parts of technical standards such as en 319 401 (for general policy requirements for tsps) and ts 119 461 (for identity proofing of relying party representatives).

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: The Commission SHALL ensure that a technical specification is created, describing at least 1. the contents and format of registration certificates for Relying Parties, see the other requirements in this section below. 2. the signing method(s) used to ensure the authenticity of the registration certificate. 3. the trust infrastructure necessary for signing registration certificates and for verifying these signatures, including the use of Trusted Lists to establish trust in Providers of registration certificates and to distribute their trust anchors to Wallet Units. 4. the method used for binding each registration certificate to the access certificate that will be used in the same presentation request. This binding method SHALL enable a Wallet Unit to verify that the registration certificate is bound to the entity that authenticated itself using the access certificate. The binding method SHALL consider situations in which a Relying Party uses the services of an intermediary (see [Topic 52](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2330-topic-52-relying-party-intermediaries)) to connect to the Wallet Unit. 5. whether or not a registration certificate must have a validity period. 6. the method to be used for revocation of registration certificates. Moreover, the technical specification SHALL describe the impact of revocation, especially compared to the impact of revocation of the access certificate(s) of the same entity.
requirements.searchText: rprc_02 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the commission shall ensure that a technical specification is created, describing at least 1. the contents and format of registration certificates for relying parties, see the other requirements in this section below. 2. the signing method(s) used to ensure the authenticity of the registration certificate. 3. the trust infrastructure necessary for signing registration certificates and for verifying these signatures, including the use of trusted lists to establish trust in providers of registration certificates and to distribute their trust anchors to wallet units. 4. the method used for binding each registration certificate to the access certificate that will be used in the same presentation request. this binding method shall enable a wallet unit to verify that the registration certificate is bound to the entity that authenticated itself using the access certificate. the binding method shall consider situations in which a relying party uses the services of an intermediary (see [topic 52](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2330-topic-52-relying-party-intermediaries)) to connect to the wallet unit. 5. whether or not a registration certificate must have a validity period. 6. the method to be used for revocation of registration certificates. moreover, the technical specification shall describe the impact of revocation, especially compared to the impact of revocation of the access certificate(s) of the same entity.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: The contents of a registration certificate SHALL include at least the information required in Annex V of the [CIR 2025/848](https://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2025/848/oj) regarding registration of wallet-relying parties.
requirements.searchText: rprc_03 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the contents of a registration certificate shall include at least the information required in annex v of the [cir 2025/848](https://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2025/848/oj) regarding registration of wallet-relying parties.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: If the subject of the registration certificate uses the services of an intermediary (see [Topic 52](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2330-topic-52-relying-party-intermediaries)), the 'association to the intermediary' mentioned in Annex I (15) of [CIR 2025/848] SHALL consist of the user-friendly name and unique identifier of this intermediary, as meant in requirements Reg_31 and Reg_32.
requirements.notes: This name and identifier are identical to those in the access certificate of the intermediary.
requirements.searchText: rprc_04 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if the subject of the registration certificate uses the services of an intermediary (see [topic 52](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2330-topic-52-relying-party-intermediaries)), the 'association to the intermediary' mentioned in annex i (15) of [cir 2025/848] shall consist of the user-friendly name and unique identifier of this intermediary, as meant in requirements reg_31 and reg_32. this name and identifier are identical to those in the access certificate of the intermediary.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: rprc_04a registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: If the subject of the registration certificate is not a Relying Party (i.e. in the terms of CIR 2025/848, a Service Provider), the certificate SHALL NOT contain the intended use as meant in Annex I (9) and (10) of CIR 2025/848.
requirements.notes: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider may request attributes from the Wallet Unit during issuance. If so, it registers as both a Service Provider and an Attestation Provider, and consequently its registration certificate contains its intended use.
requirements.searchText: rprc_05 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if the subject of the registration certificate is not a relying party (i.e. in the terms of cir 2025/848, a service provider), the certificate shall not contain the intended use as meant in annex i (9) and (10) of cir 2025/848. a pid provider or attestation provider may request attributes from the wallet unit during issuance. if so, it registers as both a service provider and an attestation provider, and consequently its registration certificate contains its intended use.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: The contents of a registration certificate SHALL include a name for the subject of the certificate, in a format suitable for presenting to a User.
requirements.notes: A Wallet Unit needs the name of a Relying Party at least when requesting User approval according to [[Topic 6](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a234-topic-6---relying-party-authentication-and-user-approval)]
requirements.searchText: rprc_06 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the contents of a registration certificate shall include a name for the subject of the certificate, in a format suitable for presenting to a user. a wallet unit needs the name of a relying party at least when requesting user approval according to [[topic 6](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a234-topic-6---relying-party-authentication-and-user-approval)]

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: The contents of a registration certificate SHALL include an EU-wide unique identifier for the subject of the certificate.
requirements.notes: a) A Wallet Unit needs an identifier for a Relying Party at least to allow the User to send a report of suspicious Relying Party presentation requests to a data protection authority according to [Topic 50](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2328-topic-50---blueprint-to-report-unlawful-or-suspicious-request-of-data). b) The EU-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a concatenated list of one or more registered official Relying Party identifiers listed in Annex I(3) of the [CIR 2025/848](https://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2025/848/oj) regarding registration of Wallet Relying Parties, expressed in the semantic form defined in [ETSI EN 319 412-1] sections 5.1.4 or 5.1.5.
requirements.searchText: rprc_07 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the contents of a registration certificate shall include an eu-wide unique identifier for the subject of the certificate. a) a wallet unit needs an identifier for a relying party at least to allow the user to send a report of suspicious relying party presentation requests to a data protection authority according to [topic 50](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2328-topic-50---blueprint-to-report-unlawful-or-suspicious-request-of-data). b) the eu-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a concatenated list of one or more registered official relying party identifiers listed in annex i(3) of the [cir 2025/848](https://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2025/848/oj) regarding registration of wallet relying parties, expressed in the semantic form defined in [etsi en 319 412-1] sections 5.1.4 or 5.1.5.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
requirements.specification: The EU-wide unique identifier meant in RPRC_07 SHALL be identical in all registration certificates issued for a given entity.
requirements.notes: In case the registration certificates issued to an intermediated Relying Party are held and presented by an intermediary, the entity meant in this requirement is the intermediated Relying Party. An intermediary may obtain and hold registration certificates with a different unique identifier for other intermediated Relying Parties.
requirements.searchText: rprc_08 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the eu-wide unique identifier meant in rprc_07 shall be identical in all registration certificates issued for a given entity. in case the registration certificates issued to an intermediated relying party are held and presented by an intermediary, the entity meant in this requirement is the intermediated relying party. an intermediary may obtain and hold registration certificates with a different unique identifier for other intermediated relying parties.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: B Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to Relying Parties
requirements.specification: A Member State Registrar MAY decide that, during the registration process for Relying Parties, as specified in [Topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), a Provider of registration certificates associated to the Registrar must create and sign or seal one or more registration certificates. If the Registrar decides to do so, the Provider of registration certificates SHALL create and sign or seal a separate registration certificate for each intended use registered by each Relying Party, and issue it to the Relying Party. Each registration certificate SHALL comply with the requirements in the technical specification mentioned in RPRC_02.
requirements.notes: See also [Topic 52](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2330-topic-52-relying-party-intermediaries).
requirements.searchText: rprc_09 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state registrar may decide that, during the registration process for relying parties, as specified in [topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), a provider of registration certificates associated to the registrar must create and sign or seal one or more registration certificates. if the registrar decides to do so, the provider of registration certificates shall create and sign or seal a separate registration certificate for each intended use registered by each relying party, and issue it to the relying party. each registration certificate shall comply with the requirements in the technical specification mentioned in rprc_02. see also [topic 52](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2330-topic-52-relying-party-intermediaries).

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: B Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to Relying Parties
requirements.specification: If, during registration, a Relying Party received one or more registration certificates, it SHALL distribute these to all its Relying Party Instances.
requirements.searchText: rprc_10 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if, during registration, a relying party received one or more registration certificates, it shall distribute these to all its relying party instances.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: B Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to Relying Parties
requirements.specification: The contents of a registration certificate issued to a Relying Party SHALL at least one of the following: a) the URL of a web form provided by the Relying Party, which Users can use to send data deletion requests, b) an e-mail address of the Relying Party, on which the Relying Party is prepared to receive data deletion requests from Users, c) a telephone number of the Relying Party, on which the Relying Party is prepared to receive data deletion requests from Users.
requirements.notes: See [Topic 48](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2327-topic-48---blueprint-for-requesting-data-deletion-to-relying-parties) for more information about data deletion requests.
requirements.searchText: rprc_11 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the contents of a registration certificate issued to a relying party shall at least one of the following: a) the url of a web form provided by the relying party, which users can use to send data deletion requests, b) an e-mail address of the relying party, on which the relying party is prepared to receive data deletion requests from users, c) a telephone number of the relying party, on which the relying party is prepared to receive data deletion requests from users. see [topic 48](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2327-topic-48---blueprint-for-requesting-data-deletion-to-relying-parties) for more information about data deletion requests.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: B Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to Relying Parties
requirements.specification: The contents of a registration certificate issued to a Relying Party SHALL contain the name and country of the Data Protection Authority supervising the Relying Party. In addition, the registration certificate SHALL contain at least one of the following: a) the URL of a web form provided by the DPA, which Users can use to report suspicious attribute presentation requests. c) an e-mail address of the DPA, on which the DPA is prepared to receive reports about suspicious attribute presentation requests from Users, c) a telephone number of the DPA, on which the DPA is prepared to receive reports about suspicious attribute presentation requests from Users.
requirements.notes: See [Topic 50](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2328-topic-50---blueprint-to-report-unlawful-or-suspicious-request-of-data) for more information about reporting suspicious attribute presentation requests.
requirements.searchText: rprc_12 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the contents of a registration certificate issued to a relying party shall contain the name and country of the data protection authority supervising the relying party. in addition, the registration certificate shall contain at least one of the following: a) the url of a web form provided by the dpa, which users can use to report suspicious attribute presentation requests. c) an e-mail address of the dpa, on which the dpa is prepared to receive reports about suspicious attribute presentation requests from users, c) a telephone number of the dpa, on which the dpa is prepared to receive reports about suspicious attribute presentation requests from users. see [topic 50](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2328-topic-50---blueprint-to-report-unlawful-or-suspicious-request-of-data) for more information about reporting suspicious attribute presentation requests.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to PID Providers and Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: A Registrar MAY decide that, during the registration process for PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Provider, or non-qualified EAA Providers, as specified in [Topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), a Provider of registration certificates associated to the Member State Registrar must create and sign or seal a registration certificate and issue it to the registering party. If so, that registration certificate SHALL comply with the requirements in the technical specification mentioned in RPRC_02.
requirements.searchText: rprc_13 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar may decide that, during the registration process for pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa provider, or non-qualified eaa providers, as specified in [topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), a provider of registration certificates associated to the member state registrar must create and sign or seal a registration certificate and issue it to the registering party. if so, that registration certificate shall comply with the requirements in the technical specification mentioned in rprc_02.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to PID Providers and Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: If, during registration, a PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, or non-qualified EAA Provider received a registration certificate, it SHALL distribute it to all its service supply points.
requirements.notes: A service supply point is a system at which a Wallet Unit can start the process of requesting and obtaining a PID or attestation.
requirements.searchText: rprc_14 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if, during registration, a pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, or non-qualified eaa provider received a registration certificate, it shall distribute it to all its service supply points. a service supply point is a system at which a wallet unit can start the process of requesting and obtaining a pid or attestation.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: C. Requirements on the issuance of registration certificates to PID Providers and Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: The contents of a registration certificate issued to a PID Provider, a QEAA Provider, a PuB-EAA Provider, or a non-qualified EAA Provider SHALL contain the type(s) of attestation that this entity intends to issue to Wallet Units.
requirements.searchText: rprc_15 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the contents of a registration certificate issued to a pid provider, a qeaa provider, a pub-eaa provider, or a non-qualified eaa provider shall contain the type(s) of attestation that this entity intends to issue to wallet units.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: Either after receiving a presentation request or as a general User setting, a Wallet Unit SHALL offer the User the possibility to indicate whether the User wants to verify the information registered by the competent Registrar about the Relying Party the User is interacting with.
requirements.searchText: rprc_16 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties either after receiving a presentation request or as a general user setting, a wallet unit shall offer the user the possibility to indicate whether the user wants to verify the information registered by the competent registrar about the relying party the user is interacting with.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: If the User indicated that they want to verify the information registered about the Relying Party and the Relying Party sent a registration certificate to the Wallet Unit, the Wallet Unit SHALL verify the authenticity and validity of the registration certificate according to the technical specification meant in RPRC_02. If the outcome of the verification is negative, the Wallet Unit SHALL, when asking for User approval according to RPA_07, notify the User that it could not obtain the information registered about the entity.
requirements.searchText: rprc_17 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if the user indicated that they want to verify the information registered about the relying party and the relying party sent a registration certificate to the wallet unit, the wallet unit shall verify the authenticity and validity of the registration certificate according to the technical specification meant in rprc_02. if the outcome of the verification is negative, the wallet unit shall, when asking for user approval according to rpa_07, notify the user that it could not obtain the information registered about the entity.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: If the User indicated that they want to verify the information registered about the Relying Party, but the Relying Party did not send a registration certificate to the Wallet Unit, the Wallet Unit SHALL connect to the URL of the online service of the Registrar to obtain this information. If the Wallet Unit cannot connect to this URL or if it cannot verify the authenticity and validity of the registered information, it SHALL, when asking for User approval according to RPA_07, notify the User that it could not obtain the information registered about the Relying Party.
requirements.notes: The URL of the Registrar is included in the extension of the presentation request, see RPRC_19a.
requirements.searchText: rprc_18 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if the user indicated that they want to verify the information registered about the relying party, but the relying party did not send a registration certificate to the wallet unit, the wallet unit shall connect to the url of the online service of the registrar to obtain this information. if the wallet unit cannot connect to this url or if it cannot verify the authenticity and validity of the registered information, it shall, when asking for user approval according to rpa_07, notify the user that it could not obtain the information registered about the relying party. the url of the registrar is included in the extension of the presentation request, see rprc_19a.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: If a Relying Party Instance received one or more registration certificates (see RPRC_10), it SHALL include a single registration certificate applicable for its current intended use in each presentation request to a Wallet Unit, according to the applicable standard's extension mentioned in RPRC_20. The registration certificate SHALL be included in the request by value, not by reference. The Relying Party Instance SHALL do so both in proximity and remote presentation flows.
requirements.notes: This ensures that no external requests are necessary to validate the Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: rprc_19 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if a relying party instance received one or more registration certificates (see rprc_10), it shall include a single registration certificate applicable for its current intended use in each presentation request to a wallet unit, according to the applicable standard's extension mentioned in rprc_20. the registration certificate shall be included in the request by value, not by reference. the relying party instance shall do so both in proximity and remote presentation flows. this ensures that no external requests are necessary to validate the relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHALL include in each presentation request the following information,  according to the applicable standard's extension mentioned in RPRC_20a: a) the user-friendly name of the Relying Party, b)the unique identifier of the Relying Party, c) a User-friendly description of the intended use of the Relying Party, d) the URL of the Registrar of the Relying Party, and e) the identifier of the intended use of the Relying Party.
requirements.notes: Including items a) and b) enables the Wallet Unit to show to the User the name of the Relying Party. Including c) enables the Wallet Unit to inform the User about the intended use. Including c) and d) enables the Wallet Unit, if desired by the User, to request from the Registrar the attributes registered by the Relying Party for this intended use, as well as the corresponding privacy policy and other registered information. See [Technical Specification 5](../../technical-specifications/ts5-common-formats-and-api-for-rp-registration-information.md) for the definition of this information. Note that in case the Relying Party Instance is operated by an intermediary, items a) - e) pertain to the intermediated Relying Party, see also RPI_06.
requirements.searchText: rprc_19a registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a relying party instance shall include in each presentation request the following information,  according to the applicable standard's extension mentioned in rprc_20a: a) the user-friendly name of the relying party, b)the unique identifier of the relying party, c) a user-friendly description of the intended use of the relying party, d) the url of the registrar of the relying party, and e) the identifier of the intended use of the relying party. including items a) and b) enables the wallet unit to show to the user the name of the relying party. including c) enables the wallet unit to inform the user about the intended use. including c) and d) enables the wallet unit, if desired by the user, to request from the registrar the attributes registered by the relying party for this intended use, as well as the corresponding privacy policy and other registered information. see [technical specification 5](../../technical-specifications/ts5-common-formats-and-api-for-rp-registration-information.md) for the definition of this information. note that in case the relying party instance is operated by an intermediary, items a) - e) pertain to the intermediated relying party, see also rpi_06.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: Relying Party Instances and Wallet Units SHALL support the extension for [ISO/IEC 18013-5] or the extension for [OpenID4VP], as specified in ETSI TS 119 472-2 and amended by a CIR in preparation, as applicable, for transferring a single Relying Party registration certificate from a Relying Party Instance to a Wallet Unit.
requirements.notes: The correct CIR will be referenced here when it is published.
requirements.searchText: rprc_20 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties relying party instances and wallet units shall support the extension for [iso/iec 18013-5] or the extension for [openid4vp], as specified in etsi ts 119 472-2 and amended by a cir in preparation, as applicable, for transferring a single relying party registration certificate from a relying party instance to a wallet unit. the correct cir will be referenced here when it is published.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: Relying Party Instances and Wallet Units SHALL support the extension for [ISO/IEC 18013-5] or the extension for [OpenID4VP], as specified in ETSI TS 119 472-2 and amended by a CIR in preparation, as applicable, for transferring the information listed in RPRC_19a from a Relying Party Instance to a Wallet Unit.
requirements.notes: The correct CIR will be referenced here when it is published.
requirements.searchText: rprc_20a registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties relying party instances and wallet units shall support the extension for [iso/iec 18013-5] or the extension for [openid4vp], as specified in etsi ts 119 472-2 and amended by a cir in preparation, as applicable, for transferring the information listed in rprc_19a from a relying party instance to a wallet unit. the correct cir will be referenced here when it is published.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: D. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of Relying Parties
requirements.specification: If the User indicated that they want to verify the information registered about a Relying Party and the Wallet Unit retrieved this information either from the registration certificate or from the online service of the Registrar (see RPRC_16 - RPRC_18), it SHALL verify that all attributes requested in the presentation request are included in the list of attributes registered by the Registrar. If the outcome of the verification is negative, the Wallet Unit SHALL, when asking for User approval according to RPA_07, notify the User about the requested attributes that the Relying Party did not register.
requirements.searchText: rprc_21 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if the user indicated that they want to verify the information registered about a relying party and the wallet unit retrieved this information either from the registration certificate or from the online service of the registrar (see rprc_16 - rprc_18), it shall verify that all attributes requested in the presentation request are included in the list of attributes registered by the registrar. if the outcome of the verification is negative, the wallet unit shall, when asking for user approval according to rpa_07, notify the user about the requested attributes that the relying party did not register.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of PID Providers and Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: If a PID Provider or Attestation Provider received a registration certificate (see RPRC_14), it SHALL include the registration certificate in its Issuer metadata used in the common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01. The registration certificate SHALL be included in the metadata by value, not by reference.
requirements.notes: a) This ensures that no external requests are necessary to validate the PID Provider or Attestation Provider, and that issuance transactions are atomic and self-contained. b) See also ISSU_22 - ISSU_22b and ISSU_32 - ISSU_32b.
requirements.searchText: rprc_22 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties if a pid provider or attestation provider received a registration certificate (see rprc_14), it shall include the registration certificate in its issuer metadata used in the common openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01. the registration certificate shall be included in the metadata by value, not by reference. a) this ensures that no external requests are necessary to validate the pid provider or attestation provider, and that issuance transactions are atomic and self-contained. b) see also issu_22 - issu_22b and issu_32 - issu_32b.

requirements.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
requirements.subsection: E. Requirements on the presentation and verification of registration certificates of PID Providers and Attestation Providers
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the type of attestation it wants to request from the PID Provider or Attestation Provider is registered by the relevant Registrar, according to ISSU_24a for PID Providers and ISSU_34a for Attestation Providers.
requirements.notes: Unlike for Relying Parties, see RPRC_21, the Wallet Unit always carries out this verification, regardless of the preference of the User set as per RPRC_16.
requirements.searchText: rprc_23 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a wallet unit shall verify that the type of attestation it wants to request from the pid provider or attestation provider is registered by the relevant registrar, according to issu_24a for pid providers and issu_34a for attestation providers. unlike for relying parties, see rprc_21, the wallet unit always carries out this verification, regardless of the preference of the user set as per rprc_16.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: An intermediary SHALL register as a Relying Party, in accordance with all requirements in [Topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), while indicating it intends to act as an intermediary.
requirements.notes: a) This implies that an intermediary obtains an access certificate containing its own name and unique Relying Party identifier. b) An intermediary may also obtain a registration certificate according to [Topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), but this certificate will not be used for intermediated transactions. c) An entity that registered as an intermediary may also register as a Relying Party in its own capacity. In such a case, it will receive one or more registration certificates for its intended use(s), and will use one of these certificates when interacting with a Wallet Unit.
requirements.searchText: rpi_01 relying party intermediaries an intermediary shall register as a relying party, in accordance with all requirements in [topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), while indicating it intends to act as an intermediary. a) this implies that an intermediary obtains an access certificate containing its own name and unique relying party identifier. b) an intermediary may also obtain a registration certificate according to [topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties), but this certificate will not be used for intermediated transactions. c) an entity that registered as an intermediary may also register as a relying party in its own capacity. in such a case, it will receive one or more registration certificates for its intended use(s), and will use one of these certificates when interacting with a wallet unit.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: rpi_02 relying party intermediaries empty

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: An intermediary SHALL register each intermediated Relying Party it is acting on behalf of at a Registrar in the Member State where the intermediated Relying Party is established, according all requirements in [Topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties). If a Provider of registration certificates associated with the Registrar issues registration certificates, the intermediary SHALL receive a registration certificate for each of the registered intended uses of the intermediated Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: rpi_03 relying party intermediaries an intermediary shall register each intermediated relying party it is acting on behalf of at a registrar in the member state where the intermediated relying party is established, according all requirements in [topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties). if a provider of registration certificates associated with the registrar issues registration certificates, the intermediary shall receive a registration certificate for each of the registered intended uses of the intermediated relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: When registering an intermediated Relying Party, an intermediary SHALL provide legally valid evidence that this Relying Party will indeed use the services of this intermediary to interact with Wallet Units. The Registrar SHALL verify this evidence, and, if it is found to be correct, SHALL register the relationship between the intermediary and the intermediated Relying Party.
requirements.notes: Such evidence may, for instance, be a contract between the intermediary and the intermediated Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: rpi_04 relying party intermediaries when registering an intermediated relying party, an intermediary shall provide legally valid evidence that this relying party will indeed use the services of this intermediary to interact with wallet units. the registrar shall verify this evidence, and, if it is found to be correct, shall register the relationship between the intermediary and the intermediated relying party. such evidence may, for instance, be a contract between the intermediary and the intermediated relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: When an intermediated Relying Party asks its intermediary to request some attributes from a Wallet Unit, it SHALL specify  a) its user-friendly name, b) its unique identifier, c) the URL of its Registrar. d) the identifier of its intended use, e) a User-friendly description of its intended use. In addition, if the intermediated Relying Party has registration certificates, it SHALL indicate which single registration certificate the intermediary must include in the presentation request.
requirements.notes: a) See RPRC_19a for why the intermediary needs this information. b)  Since a), b) and c) will not change for each request, specification of this information can be done once. The same is true for d) and e) if the intermediated Relying Party has only one registered intended use.
requirements.searchText: rpi_05 relying party intermediaries when an intermediated relying party asks its intermediary to request some attributes from a wallet unit, it shall specify  a) its user-friendly name, b) its unique identifier, c) the url of its registrar. d) the identifier of its intended use, e) a user-friendly description of its intended use. in addition, if the intermediated relying party has registration certificates, it shall indicate which single registration certificate the intermediary must include in the presentation request. a) see rprc_19a for why the intermediary needs this information. b)  since a), b) and c) will not change for each request, specification of this information can be done once. the same is true for d) and e) if the intermediated relying party has only one registered intended use.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: When requested by an intermediated Relying Party, an intermediary SHALL request a presentation of attributes from a specific Wallet Unit. In the request, the intermediary SHALL include the intermediary's access certificate meant in requirement RPI_01 and the registration certificate of the Relying Party, as meant in RPI_03, if available. In addition, whether or not a registration certificate is available, the intermediary SHALL include in the request the information about the intermediated Relying Party required in RPRC_19a.
requirements.searchText: rpi_06 relying party intermediaries when requested by an intermediated relying party, an intermediary shall request a presentation of attributes from a specific wallet unit. in the request, the intermediary shall include the intermediary's access certificate meant in requirement rpi_01 and the registration certificate of the relying party, as meant in rpi_03, if available. in addition, whether or not a registration certificate is available, the intermediary shall include in the request the information about the intermediated relying party required in rprc_19a.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: rpi_06a relying party intermediaries empty

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: In case a Wallet Unit receives a presentation request from an intermediary on behalf of an intermediated Relying Party, it SHALL display the names and identifiers of both the intermediary and the intermediated Relying Party to the User when asking for User approval, as described in RPA_07.
requirements.notes: In this case, the name and identifier of the intermediary are included in the access certificate presented by the Relying Party Instance, whereas the name and identifier of the intermediated Relying Party are included in the extension of the presentation  request (see RPRC_19a), and in the registration certificate if available. If these names and identifiers are different, the Wallet Unit knows that the presentation request is from an intermediary on behalf of an intermediated Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: rpi_07 relying party intermediaries in case a wallet unit receives a presentation request from an intermediary on behalf of an intermediated relying party, it shall display the names and identifiers of both the intermediary and the intermediated relying party to the user when asking for user approval, as described in rpa_07. in this case, the name and identifier of the intermediary are included in the access certificate presented by the relying party instance, whereas the name and identifier of the intermediated relying party are included in the extension of the presentation  request (see rprc_19a), and in the registration certificate if available. if these names and identifiers are different, the wallet unit knows that the presentation request is from an intermediary on behalf of an intermediated relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: In case a Wallet Unit receives a presentation request from an intermediary on behalf of an intermediated Relying Party, and if the User indicated that they want to verify the information registered about this Relying Party (according to RPRC_16), the Wallet Unit SHALL verify that that the contractual relationship between the Relying Party and the intermediary is indeed registered by the responsible Registrar according to RPI_04, see also RPRC_04.  If this verification fails, the Wallet Unit SHALL notify the User when asking for User consent.
requirements.notes: The Wallet Unit can either do this by inspecting the registration certificate (if available) or by querying the Registrar.
requirements.searchText: rpi_07a relying party intermediaries in case a wallet unit receives a presentation request from an intermediary on behalf of an intermediated relying party, and if the user indicated that they want to verify the information registered about this relying party (according to rprc_16), the wallet unit shall verify that that the contractual relationship between the relying party and the intermediary is indeed registered by the responsible registrar according to rpi_04, see also rprc_04.  if this verification fails, the wallet unit shall notify the user when asking for user consent. the wallet unit can either do this by inspecting the registration certificate (if available) or by querying the registrar.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: rpi_07b relying party intermediaries empty

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: When a Wallet Unit presents to an intermediary any User attributes from a PID or attestation, the intermediary SHALL, after successfully carrying out the verifications in RPI_09, forward these attributes (only) to the Relying Party on behalf of which the presentation request was made. If any of the verifications in RPI_09 fail, the intermediary SHALL NOT forward any attributes to the Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: rpi_08 relying party intermediaries when a wallet unit presents to an intermediary any user attributes from a pid or attestation, the intermediary shall, after successfully carrying out the verifications in rpi_09, forward these attributes (only) to the relying party on behalf of which the presentation request was made. if any of the verifications in rpi_09 fail, the intermediary shall not forward any attributes to the relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: When a Wallet Unit presents to an intermediary any attributes from a PID or attestation, the intermediary SHALL verify the authenticity of the PID or attestation, its revocation status, device binding, and User binding, as well as any combined presentation of attributes, if applicable, as specified in this ARF and if agreed with the Relying Party. Furthermore, the intermediary SHALL verify the authenticity of the Wallet Unit and its revocation status, as specified in this ARF, if agreed with the Relying Party.
requirements.notes: This ARF does not mandate that a Relying Party must carry out all of these verifications. Therefore, the intermediary and any Relying Party using its services must agree on what verifications the intermediary will carry out.
requirements.searchText: rpi_09 relying party intermediaries when a wallet unit presents to an intermediary any attributes from a pid or attestation, the intermediary shall verify the authenticity of the pid or attestation, its revocation status, device binding, and user binding, as well as any combined presentation of attributes, if applicable, as specified in this arf and if agreed with the relying party. furthermore, the intermediary shall verify the authenticity of the wallet unit and its revocation status, as specified in this arf, if agreed with the relying party. this arf does not mandate that a relying party must carry out all of these verifications. therefore, the intermediary and any relying party using its services must agree on what verifications the intermediary will carry out.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party intermediaries
requirements.specification: The intermediary SHALL delete any PIDs or attestations it obtained from the Wallet Unit, including any User attributes, completely and immediately after it has sent the User attributes to the intermediated Relying Party. If the intermediary does not send any User attributes to the intermediated Relying Party, for example because one of the verifications in the previous step failed, the intermediary SHALL delete the PIDs, attestations, or WUAs completely and immediately as soon as it has completed all necessary verifications.
requirements.searchText: rpi_10 relying party intermediaries the intermediary shall delete any pids or attestations it obtained from the wallet unit, including any user attributes, completely and immediately after it has sent the user attributes to the intermediated relying party. if the intermediary does not send any user attributes to the intermediated relying party, for example because one of the verifications in the previous step failed, the intermediary shall delete the pids, attestations, or wuas completely and immediately as soon as it has completed all necessary verifications.

OIA_01.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_01.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support [OpenID4VP] for remote presentation flows and [ISO/IEC 18013-5] for proximity presentation flows, to receive and respond to presentation requests for person identification data (PID) and attestations by Relying Parties.
OIA_01.searchText: oia_01 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support [openid4vp] for remote presentation flows and [iso/iec 18013-5] for proximity presentation flows, to receive and respond to presentation requests for person identification data (pid) and attestations by relying parties.

OIA_02.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_02.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support proving cryptographic device binding between the WSCA/WSCD or a keystore included in the Wallet Unit and a PID or attestation, in accordance with [SD-JWT VC] or [ISO/IEC 18013-5].
OIA_02.notes: Such a mechanism is called 'mdoc authentication' in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [SD-JWT VC].
OIA_02.searchText: oia_02 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support proving cryptographic device binding between the wsca/wscd or a keystore included in the wallet unit and a pid or attestation, in accordance with [sd-jwt vc] or [iso/iec 18013-5]. such a mechanism is called 'mdoc authentication' in [iso/iec 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [sd-jwt vc].

OIA_03.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_03.searchText: oia_03 accessing online services with a wallet unit empty

OIA_03a.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_03a.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that their Wallet Solution supports the protocol specified in 'OpenID for Verifiable Presentations', see [OpenID4VP], with additions and changes as documented in this Annex and in technical specifications referenced in this Annex.
OIA_03a.searchText: oia_03a accessing online services with a wallet unit wallet providers shall ensure that their wallet solution supports the protocol specified in 'openid for verifiable presentations', see [openid4vp], with additions and changes as documented in this annex and in technical specifications referenced in this annex.

OIA_03b.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_03b.specification: For remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], Relying Parties and Wallet Units SHALL comply with the requirements in the profile for OpenID4VP specified in [ISO/IEC 18013-7] Annex B.
OIA_03b.searchText: oia_03b accessing online services with a wallet unit for remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [iso/iec 18013-5], relying parties and wallet units shall comply with the requirements in the profile for openid4vp specified in [iso/iec 18013-7] annex b.

OIA_03c.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_03c.specification: For remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [SD-JWT VC], Relying Parties and Wallet Units SHALL comply with the requirements in the 'OpenID for Verifiable Presentations for IETF SD-JWT VC' profile specified in [HAIP].
OIA_03c.searchText: oia_03c accessing online services with a wallet unit for remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [sd-jwt vc], relying parties and wallet units shall comply with the requirements in the 'openid for verifiable presentations for ietf sd-jwt vc' profile specified in [haip].

OIA_04.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_04.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL verify and process PID or attestation presentation requests from Relying Parties in accordance with the protocols and interfaces specified in [OpenID4VP] for remote flows.
OIA_04.searchText: oia_04 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall verify and process pid or attestation presentation requests from relying parties in accordance with the protocols and interfaces specified in [openid4vp] for remote flows.

OIA_05.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_05.specification: After verifying and processing a PID or attestation request, the Wallet Unit SHALL display to the User the identity of the requesting Relying Party and the requested attributes.
OIA_05.searchText: oia_05 accessing online services with a wallet unit after verifying and processing a pid or attestation request, the wallet unit shall display to the user the identity of the requesting relying party and the requested attributes.

OIA_06.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_06.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL present the requested attributes only after having received the User's authorisation.
OIA_06.searchText: oia_06 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall present the requested attributes only after having received the user's authorisation. see also oia_07.

OIA_07.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_07.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support selective disclosure of attributes from PIDs and attestations to be released to the requesting Relying Parties.
OIA_07.searchText: oia_07 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support selective disclosure of attributes from pids and attestations to be released to the requesting relying parties.

OIA_08.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_08.specification: Wallet Units and Relying Party Instances SHALL support the [W3C Digital Credentials API]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for remote presentation flows, provided that a) this API is a W3C Recommendation, b) this API complies with the expectations outlined in [Chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3) of the Topic F discussion paper, and c) this API is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.
OIA_08.searchText: oia_08 accessing online services with a wallet unit wallet units and relying party instances shall support the [w3c digital credentials api]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for remote presentation flows, provided that a) this api is a w3c recommendation, b) this api complies with the expectations outlined in [chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3) of the topic f discussion paper, and c) this api is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.

OIA_08a.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_08a.specification: If Wallet Units and Relying Party Instances do not support the [W3C Digital Credentials API], they SHALL implement adequate mitigations for the challenges described in [Section 4.4.3.1](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#4431-introduction) of the ARF main document.
OIA_08a.searchText: oia_08a accessing online services with a wallet unit if wallet units and relying party instances do not support the [w3c digital credentials api], they shall implement adequate mitigations for the challenges described in [section 4.4.3.1](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#4431-introduction) of the arf main document.

OIA_08b.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_08b.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], it SHALL, by default (see OIA_08d), disclose the presence of all stored attestations (mean their attestation type) to the Digital Credentials API framework, but it SHALL NOT disclose the attributes and their values in these attestations.
OIA_08b.notes: The latter restriction applies even if such disclosure would enhance the services provided by the operating system to the Wallet Unit, for example, attestation selection in the context of the Digital Credentials API.
OIA_08b.searchText: oia_08b accessing online services with a wallet unit if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api], it shall, by default (see oia_08d), disclose the presence of all stored attestations (mean their attestation type) to the digital credentials api framework, but it shall not disclose the attributes and their values in these attestations. the latter restriction applies even if such disclosure would enhance the services provided by the operating system to the wallet unit, for example, attestation selection in the context of the digital credentials api.

OIA_08c.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_08c.specification: If a Relying Party supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], the Relying Party's presentation request MAY be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for searching available attestations, for preventing fraud targeting the User, or for troubleshooting purposes. Moreover, the request SHOULD be processed by the browser and/or the Operating System for User security purposes. However, the request SHALL NOT be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for market analysis purposes (including as a secondary purpose) or for the browser's and/or the operating system's own purposes.
OIA_08c.searchText: oia_08c accessing online services with a wallet unit if a relying party supports the [w3c digital credentials api], the relying party's presentation request may be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for searching available attestations, for preventing fraud targeting the user, or for troubleshooting purposes. moreover, the request should be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for user security purposes. however, the request shall not be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for market analysis purposes (including as a secondary purpose) or for the browser's and/or the operating system's own purposes.

OIA_08d.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_08d.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], it SHALL provide a global User setting to disable the disclosure of stored attestations via the Digital Credentials API framework, as described in OIA_08b. When this setting is disabled, the Wallet Unit SHALL NOT advertise or respond to presentation requests or issuance requested communicated via the DC API.
OIA_08d.searchText: oia_08d accessing online services with a wallet unit if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api], it shall provide a global user setting to disable the disclosure of stored attestations via the digital credentials api framework, as described in oia_08b. when this setting is disabled, the wallet unit shall not advertise or respond to presentation requests or issuance requested communicated via the dc api.
