OIA_08e.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_08e.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], it SHALL use the CTAP-Hybrid flow only if the expectations outlined in Chapter 4 of the [Topic F discussion paper](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md) are met.
OIA_08e.searchText: oia_08e accessing online services with a wallet unit if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api], it shall use the ctap-hybrid flow only if the expectations outlined in chapter 4 of the [topic f discussion paper](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md) are met.

OIA_09.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_09.specification: For remote presentation flows the Wallet Unit SHALL ensure that the attributes included in the presented attestation are accessible only to the Relying Party Instance, by encrypting the presentation response. The technical specification meant in OIA_03a SHALL specify mechanisms preventing decryption of the presentation response via Man-in-the-Middle attacks by the browser, the operating system, or other components between the Wallet Unit and the Relying Party.
OIA_09.searchText: oia_09 accessing online services with a wallet unit for remote presentation flows the wallet unit shall ensure that the attributes included in the presented attestation are accessible only to the relying party instance, by encrypting the presentation response. the technical specification meant in oia_03a shall specify mechanisms preventing decryption of the presentation response via man-in-the-middle attacks by the browser, the operating system, or other components between the wallet unit and the relying party.

OIA_10.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_10.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a Wallet Unit contains two PIDs having the same encoding (e.g. ISO/IEC 18013-5 or SD-JWT VC-compliant) and a Relying Party requests a PID, the Wallet Unit SHALL ask the User which of these PIDs they want to release, unless the Wallet Unit can decide from context.
OIA_10.searchText: oia_10 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a wallet unit contains two pids having the same encoding (e.g. iso/iec 18013-5 or sd-jwt vc-compliant) and a relying party requests a pid, the wallet unit shall ask the user which of these pids they want to release, unless the wallet unit can decide from context.

OIA_11.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_11.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a Wallet Unit contains two attestations having the same encoding (e.g. ISO/IEC 18013-5 or SD-JWT VC-compliant) and the same attestation type, and a Relying Party requests an attestation of that type and encoding, the Wallet Unit SHALL ask the User which of these attestations they want to release, unless the Wallet Unit can decide from context.
OIA_11.searchText: oia_11 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a wallet unit contains two attestations having the same encoding (e.g. iso/iec 18013-5 or sd-jwt vc-compliant) and the same attestation type, and a relying party requests an attestation of that type and encoding, the wallet unit shall ask the user which of these attestations they want to release, unless the wallet unit can decide from context. attestation types are explained in [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)].

OIA_12.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_12.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the signature of a PID using a trust anchor provided in a PID Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [[Topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].
OIA_12.searchText: oia_12 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the signature of a pid using a trust anchor provided in a pid provider trusted list made available in accordance with [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].

OIA_13.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_13.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the qualified signature of a QEAA in accordance with Art.32 of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For the verification, the Relying Party SHALL use a trust anchor provided in a QEAA Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation].
OIA_13.searchText: oia_13 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the qualified signature of a qeaa in accordance with art.32 of the [european digital identity regulation]. for the verification, the relying party shall use a trust anchor provided in a qeaa provider trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation].

OIA_14.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_14.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the qualified signature of a PuB-EAA in accordance with [Art.32](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2594-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For that verification, the Relying Party SHALL use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the QTSP supporting the qualified signature. The Relying Party SHALL also validate the qualified certificate of the QTSP using a trust anchor provided in a Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. The Relying Party SHALL also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [Article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32024R1183#d1e3902-1-1).
OIA_14.searchText: oia_14 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the qualified signature of a pub-eaa in accordance with [art.32](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2594-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation]. for that verification, the relying party shall use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the qtsp supporting the qualified signature. the relying party shall also validate the qualified certificate of the qtsp using a trust anchor provided in a trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation]. the relying party shall also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/all/?uri=celex:32024r1183#d1e3902-1-1).

OIA_15.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_15.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the signature of a non-qualified EAA using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable Rulebook, see [[Topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)].
OIA_15.notes: a) OIA_12 - OIA_15 imply that a Relying Party Instance must know if the attestation it is requesting from a Wallet Instance is a PID, a QEAA, a PuB-EAA, or a non-qualified EAA. These requirements also imply that the Relying Party Instance must store trust anchors in such a way that, at the time of verification, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for PIDs, for QEAAs, for PuB-EAAs, or for non-qualified EAAs. b) PID Providers, QEAA Providers, and PuB-EAA Providers are trusted by other actors in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or PIDs) that they are not legally allowed to issue. This trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. However, non-qualified EAA Providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. Therefore, when it receives an non-qualified attestation, a Relying Party Instance may have to verify that the non-qualified EAA Provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation, in addition to verifying the signature over the attestation using the EAA Provider's trust anchor. Mechanisms allowing to do this should be defined in the applicable Rulebook, see ARB_26.
OIA_15.searchText: oia_15 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the signature of a non-qualified eaa using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable rulebook, see [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)]. a) oia_12 - oia_15 imply that a relying party instance must know if the attestation it is requesting from a wallet instance is a pid, a qeaa, a pub-eaa, or a non-qualified eaa. these requirements also imply that the relying party instance must store trust anchors in such a way that, at the time of verification, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for pids, for qeaas, for pub-eaas, or for non-qualified eaas. b) pid providers, qeaa providers, and pub-eaa providers are trusted by other actors in the eudi wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or pids) that they are not legally allowed to issue. this trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. however, non-qualified eaa providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. therefore, when it receives an non-qualified attestation, a relying party instance may have to verify that the non-qualified eaa provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation, in addition to verifying the signature over the attestation using the eaa provider's trust anchor. mechanisms allowing to do this should be defined in the applicable rulebook, see arb_26.

OIA_16.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
OIA_16.specification: When receiving a PID or attestation, a Relying Party Instance SHALL discard the values of all unique elements, including at least the ones mentioned in requirement ISSU_35 in [Topic 10](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a237-topic-10---issuing-a-pid-or-attestation-to-a-wallet-unit), as well as any timestamps, as soon as they are no longer needed. The Relying Party Instance SHALL NOT communicate these values to the Relying Party or to any other party inside or outside the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
OIA_16.searchText: oia_16 accessing online services with a wallet unit when receiving a pid or attestation, a relying party instance shall discard the values of all unique elements, including at least the ones mentioned in requirement issu_35 in [topic 10](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a237-topic-10---issuing-a-pid-or-attestation-to-a-wallet-unit), as well as any timestamps, as soon as they are no longer needed. the relying party instance shall not communicate these values to the relying party or to any other party inside or outside the eudi wallet ecosystem.

RPA_01.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_01.specification: The Wallet Unit used by a User, as well as the Relying Party Instance used by the Relying Party, SHALL implement a mechanism for Relying Party authentication in PID or attestation presentation transactions. This mechanism SHALL: - enable the Wallet Unit to identify and authenticate the Relying Party, - enable the Wallet Unit to verify that the request from the Relying Party was not copied and replayed, - use Relying Party Instance access certificates issued in accordance with [[Topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)].
RPA_01.searchText: rpa_01 relying party authentication and user approval the wallet unit used by a user, as well as the relying party instance used by the relying party, shall implement a mechanism for relying party authentication in pid or attestation presentation transactions. this mechanism shall: - enable the wallet unit to identify and authenticate the relying party, - enable the wallet unit to verify that the request from the relying party was not copied and replayed, - use relying party instance access certificates issued in accordance with [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)].

RPA_01a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_01a.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API] for remote presentation flows, it SHALL retain full authority over the process meant in RPA_01. In particular, this process SHALL NOT be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.
RPA_01a.searchText: rpa_01a relying party authentication and user approval if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api] for remote presentation flows, it shall retain full authority over the process meant in rpa_01. in particular, this process shall not be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.

RPA_02.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_02.specification: The Commission SHALL ensure that technical specifications for the Relying Party authentication mechanism mentioned in RPA_01 are created both for Wallet Units complying with [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and for Wallet Units complying with [OpenID4VP]. These specifications SHALL comply with applicable requirements in these standards.
RPA_02.searchText: rpa_02 relying party authentication and user approval the commission shall ensure that technical specifications for the relying party authentication mechanism mentioned in rpa_01 are created both for wallet units complying with [iso/iec 18013-5] and for wallet units complying with [openid4vp]. these specifications shall comply with applicable requirements in these standards.

RPA_02a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_02a.specification: The technical specifications mentioned in RPA_02 SHALL ensure that a Relying Party Instance includes its access certificates in the presentation request by value, not by reference.
RPA_02a.notes: This ensures that no external requests are necessary to carry out Relying Party authentication, and that transactions are atomic and self-contained.
RPA_02a.searchText: rpa_02a relying party authentication and user approval the technical specifications mentioned in rpa_02 shall ensure that a relying party instance includes its access certificates in the presentation request by value, not by reference. this ensures that no external requests are necessary to carry out relying party authentication, and that transactions are atomic and self-contained.

RPA_03.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_03.specification: A Wallet Unit and a Relying Party Instance SHALL perform Relying Party authentication in all PID or attestation presentation transactions to Relying Parties, whether proximity or remote, using a Relying Party Instance access certificate.
RPA_03.notes: The actions both entities perform differ. For example, while the Relying Party creates a signature over some data in the request, the Wallet Unit validates that signature.
RPA_03.searchText: rpa_03 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit and a relying party instance shall perform relying party authentication in all pid or attestation presentation transactions to relying parties, whether proximity or remote, using a relying party instance access certificate. the actions both entities perform differ. for example, while the relying party creates a signature over some data in the request, the wallet unit validates that signature.

RPA_04.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_04.specification: For the verification of Relying Party Instance access certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Trusted List(s) of Relying Party Access Certificate Authorities of all Member States.
RPA_04.notes: For more information about Relying Party Access Certificate Authorities, please see [[Topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].
RPA_04.searchText: rpa_04 relying party authentication and user approval for the verification of relying party instance access certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in the trusted list(s) of relying party access certificate authorities of all member states. for more information about relying party access certificate authorities, please see [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].

RPA_05.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_05.specification: If Relying Party authentication fails for any reason, the Wallet Instance SHALL inform the User that the identity of the Relying Party could not be verified and that therefore the request is not trustworthy.
RPA_05.searchText: rpa_05 relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication fails for any reason, the wallet instance shall inform the user that the identity of the relying party could not be verified and that therefore the request is not trustworthy.

RPA_06.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_06.specification: If Relying Party authentication succeeds, the Wallet Instance SHALL display to the User the name of the Relying Party as included in the Relying Party access certificate, together with the attributes requested by the Relying Party. The Wallet Instance SHALL do so when asking the User for approval according to RPA_07.
RPA_06.notes: If the Relying Party is an intermediary acting on behalf of an intermediated Relying Party, the Wallet Instance displays the names of both the intermediary and the intermediated Relying Party to the User, see RPI_07.
RPA_06.searchText: rpa_06 relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication succeeds, the wallet instance shall display to the user the name of the relying party as included in the relying party access certificate, together with the attributes requested by the relying party. the wallet instance shall do so when asking the user for approval according to rpa_07. if the relying party is an intermediary acting on behalf of an intermediated relying party, the wallet instance displays the names of both the intermediary and the intermediated relying party to the user, see rpi_07.

RPA_06a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_06a.specification: If Relying Party authentication fails for any reason, the Wallet Unit SHALL notify the User. In addition, the Wallet Unit SHALL either not present the requested attributes to the Relying Party, or give the User the choice to present the requested attributes or not.
RPA_06a.notes: It is up to the Wallet Provider to make a choice for one of these two options.
RPA_06a.searchText: rpa_06a relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication fails for any reason, the wallet unit shall notify the user. in addition, the wallet unit shall either not present the requested attributes to the relying party, or give the user the choice to present the requested attributes or not. it is up to the wallet provider to make a choice for one of these two options.

RPA_07.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_07.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL ensure the User approved the release of any attribute(s) in the Wallet Unit to a Relying Party, prior to releasing these attributes. A Wallet Unit SHALL always allow the User to refuse releasing an attribute requested by the Relying Party.
RPA_07.searchText: rpa_07 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit shall ensure the user approved the release of any attribute(s) in the wallet unit to a relying party, prior to releasing these attributes. a wallet unit shall always allow the user to refuse releasing an attribute requested by the relying party.

RPA_07a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_07a.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API] for remote presentation flows, it SHALL retain full authority over the process meant in RPA_07. In particular, this process SHALL NOT be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.
RPA_07a.searchText: rpa_07a relying party authentication and user approval if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api] for remote presentation flows, it shall retain full authority over the process meant in rpa_07. in particular, this process shall not be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.

RPA_08.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_08.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL authenticate the User before allowing the User to give or refuse approval for releasing any attributes, in accordance with WIAM_14 or WIAM_15, as applicable.
RPA_08.searchText: rpa_08 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit shall authenticate the user before allowing the user to give or refuse approval for releasing any attributes, in accordance with wiam_14 or wiam_15, as applicable.

RPA_09.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_09.searchText: rpa_09 relying party authentication and user approval empty

RPA_10.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_10.specification: When asking for User approval, the Wallet Unit SHALL show to the User the User-friendly description of the Relying Party's intended use and, if available, the link to the applicable privacy policy.
RPA_10.notes: The User-friendly description of the Relying Party's intended use is included in  the presentation request and also in the registration certificate, if available. The link to the privacy policy is included in the registration certificate, or in the absence of a registration certificate, the Wallet Unit obtained the link from the Registrar's online service, if the User requested this. See RPRC_19a and other requirements in [Topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) for details.
RPA_10.searchText: rpa_10 relying party authentication and user approval when asking for user approval, the wallet unit shall show to the user the user-friendly description of the relying party's intended use and, if available, the link to the applicable privacy policy. the user-friendly description of the relying party's intended use is included in  the presentation request and also in the registration certificate, if available. the link to the privacy policy is included in the registration certificate, or in the absence of a registration certificate, the wallet unit obtained the link from the registrar's online service, if the user requested this. see rprc_19a and other requirements in [topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) for details.

RPA_10a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_10a.specification: The Wallet Unit SHOULD ensure that the User gives approval either to present all attributes requested in a presentation request, or none of them.
RPA_10a.notes: This means that a User should be asked either to approve the presentation of all requested attributes or to deny all of them. The Wallet Unit should not allow partial approval, since this would mean that the Relying Party cannot deliver the service, but nevertheless receives some User attributes. This would be a violation of the User's privacy. Note that a Relying Party is not allowed to request more data than is justified for the intended use. So if the User feels that the Relying Party is actually requesting more data than needed, that implies that the Relying Party is not trustworthy and should not receive any data.
RPA_10a.searchText: rpa_10a relying party authentication and user approval the wallet unit should ensure that the user gives approval either to present all attributes requested in a presentation request, or none of them. this means that a user should be asked either to approve the presentation of all requested attributes or to deny all of them. the wallet unit should not allow partial approval, since this would mean that the relying party cannot deliver the service, but nevertheless receives some user attributes. this would be a violation of the user's privacy. note that a relying party is not allowed to request more data than is justified for the intended use. so if the user feels that the relying party is actually requesting more data than needed, that implies that the relying party is not trustworthy and should not receive any data.

RPA_11.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_11.specification: When the presentation of an attestation is denied by the User, the Wallet Unit SHALL behave towards the Relying Party as if the attestation did not exist.
RPA_11.searchText: rpa_11 relying party authentication and user approval when the presentation of an attestation is denied by the user, the wallet unit shall behave towards the relying party as if the attestation did not exist.

RPA_12.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_12.specification: When asking for User approval, the Wallet Unit MAY indicate to the User whether the attestation requested by a Relying Party is device-bound or not.
RPA_12.notes: The intent of this indication is to warn the User than a non-device bound attestation may be copied by the Relying Party and presented to a third party.
RPA_12.searchText: rpa_12 relying party authentication and user approval when asking for user approval, the wallet unit may indicate to the user whether the attestation requested by a relying party is device-bound or not. the intent of this indication is to warn the user than a non-device bound attestation may be copied by the relying party and presented to a third party.

VCR_01.specification: A PID Provider, QEAA Provider, or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL use one of the following methods for revocation of a PID, QEAA, or PuB-EAA: - Only issue short-lived attestations having a validity period of 24 hours or less, such that revocation will never be necessary, - Use an Attestation Status List mechanism specified per VCR_11, or - Use an Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11.
VCR_01.notes: The 24-hour period originates from ETSI EN 319 411-1 V1.4.1, requirement REV-6.2.4-03A. This requires that the process of revocation must take at most 24 hours. Consequently, revocation may make no sense if the attestation is valid for less than 24 hours, because it may reach the end of its validity period before it is revoked.
VCR_01.searchText: vcr_01 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, qeaa provider, or pub-eaa provider shall use one of the following methods for revocation of a pid, qeaa, or pub-eaa: - only issue short-lived attestations having a validity period of 24 hours or less, such that revocation will never be necessary, - use an attestation status list mechanism specified per vcr_11, or - use an attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11. the 24-hour period originates from etsi en 319 411-1 v1.4.1, requirement rev-6.2.4-03a. this requires that the process of revocation must take at most 24 hours. consequently, revocation may make no sense if the attestation is valid for less than 24 hours, because it may reach the end of its validity period before it is revoked.

VCR_01a.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL use either the second or the third of the methods specified in VCR_01 for revocation of a WUA.
VCR_01a.notes: Due to requirement WUA_08 in [Topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation), it is not possible to issue short-lived WUAs. This implies that all WUAs are revocable.
VCR_01a.searchText: vcr_01a attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet provider shall use either the second or the third of the methods specified in vcr_01 for revocation of a wua. due to requirement wua_08 in [topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation), it is not possible to issue short-lived wuas. this implies that all wuas are revocable.

VCR_02.specification: For non-qualified EAAs, the relevant Rulebook SHALL specify whether that type of EAA must be revocable. If a non-qualified EAA type must be revocable, the relevant Rulebook SHALL determine which of the methods mentioned in VCR_01 must be implemented by the relevant EAA Providers for the revocation of such an EAA.
VCR_02.searchText: vcr_02 attestation revocation and revocation checking for non-qualified eaas, the relevant rulebook shall specify whether that type of eaa must be revocable. if a non-qualified eaa type must be revocable, the relevant rulebook shall determine which of the methods mentioned in vcr_01 must be implemented by the relevant eaa providers for the revocation of such an eaa.

VCR_03.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider of a given PID, or the Attestation Provider of a given attestation, SHALL be the only party in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that PID or attestation. *Note: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider MAY outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.
VCR_03.searchText: vcr_03 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider of a given pid, or the attestation provider of a given attestation, shall be the only party in the eudi wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that pid or attestation. *note: a pid provider, attestation provider may outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.

VCR_03a.specification: The Wallet Provider of a given WUA SHALL be the only party in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that WUA.
VCR_03a.notes: A Wallet Provider MAY outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.
VCR_03a.searchText: vcr_03a attestation revocation and revocation checking the wallet provider of a given wua shall be the only party in the eudi wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that wua. a wallet provider may outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.

VCR_04.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider that revoked a PID, attestation, or WUA SHALL NOT reverse the revocation.
VCR_04.searchText: vcr_04 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider that revoked a pid, attestation, or wua shall not reverse the revocation.

VCR_05.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL have a policy specifying under which conditions a PID, attestation, or WUA it issued will be revoked.
VCR_05.searchText: vcr_05 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall have a policy specifying under which conditions a pid, attestation, or wua it issued will be revoked.

VCR_06.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL revoke a PID, attestation, or WUA when its security has been compromised.
VCR_06.searchText: vcr_06 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall revoke a pid, attestation, or wua when its security has been compromised.

VCR_07.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL revoke all valid WUAs issued to a Wallet Unit upon the explicit request of the User to revoke their Wallet Unit.
VCR_07.searchText: vcr_07 attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet provider shall revoke all valid wuas issued to a wallet unit upon the explicit request of the user to revoke their wallet unit.

VCR_07a.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHOULD revoke that PID or attestation upon the explicit request of the User to whom the PID or the attestation was issued.
VCR_07a.searchText: vcr_07a attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider or attestation provider should revoke that pid or attestation upon the explicit request of the user to whom the pid or the attestation was issued.

VCR_07b.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHOULD revoke that PID if the Wallet Unit on which it resides is revoked, in compliance with requirement WURevocation_18 in [Topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).
VCR_07b.searchText: vcr_07b attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider or attestation provider should revoke that pid if the wallet unit on which it resides is revoked, in compliance with requirement wurevocation_18 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).

VCR_08.specification: If a PID is revocable, the PID Provider SHALL revoke a PID upon the death of the natural person who is the subject of the PID, or the cease of activity of the legal person who is the subject of the PID.
VCR_08.searchText: vcr_08 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid is revocable, the pid provider shall revoke a pid upon the death of the natural person who is the subject of the pid, or the cease of activity of the legal person who is the subject of the pid.

VCR_09.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL revoke a PID, attestation, or WUA if the value of one or more attributes in the PID, attestation, or WUA was changed (including attributes being added or deleted) and it is still valid for at least 24 hours. Subsequently, if the User's contact details are known, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHOULD, via an out-of-band manner, notify the User about the revocation and ask the User to request re-issuance of the PID, attestation, or WUA using their Wallet Unit.
VCR_09.notes: If the value of the attributes is determined by a party different from the Provider, such as an Authentic Source, the Provider is responsible for ensuring that this third party notifies them about such changes.
VCR_09.searchText: vcr_09 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall revoke a pid, attestation, or wua if the value of one or more attributes in the pid, attestation, or wua was changed (including attributes being added or deleted) and it is still valid for at least 24 hours. subsequently, if the user's contact details are known, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider should, via an out-of-band manner, notify the user about the revocation and ask the user to request re-issuance of the pid, attestation, or wua using their wallet unit. if the value of the attributes is determined by a party different from the provider, such as an authentic source, the provider is responsible for ensuring that this third party notifies them about such changes.

VCR_10.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL implement the attestation revocation mechanisms specified per VCR_11 in their Wallet Solutions.
VCR_10.searchText: vcr_10 attestation revocation and revocation checking wallet providers shall implement the attestation revocation mechanisms specified per vcr_11 in their wallet solutions.

VCR_11.specification: The Commission SHALL create or reference technical specifications providing all necessary details for PID Providers, Attestation Providers, and Wallet Providers to implement an Attestation Status List mechanism or an Attestation Revocation List mechanism for the PIDs, attestations, and WUAs they issue. These technical specifications SHALL also contain all details necessary for Relying Party Instances, Relying Parties, and Wallet Units interacting with other Wallet Units to use these mechanisms to verify the revocation status of PIDs, attestations, and WUAs.
VCR_11.notes: 'Attestation Status List' and 'Attestation Revocation List' are specific mechanisms, defined in Annex 1. Attestation Revocation Lists are sometimes referred to as 'Identifier Lists'.
VCR_11.searchText: vcr_11 attestation revocation and revocation checking the commission shall create or reference technical specifications providing all necessary details for pid providers, attestation providers, and wallet providers to implement an attestation status list mechanism or an attestation revocation list mechanism for the pids, attestations, and wuas they issue. these technical specifications shall also contain all details necessary for relying party instances, relying parties, and wallet units interacting with other wallet units to use these mechanisms to verify the revocation status of pids, attestations, and wuas. 'attestation status list' and 'attestation revocation list' are specific mechanisms, defined in annex 1. attestation revocation lists are sometimes referred to as 'identifier lists'.

VCR_12.specification: If a Relying Party decides it needs to be able to verify the revocation status of PIDs or attestations, it SHALL support both the Attestation Status List mechanism and the Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11.
VCR_12.notes: Per VCR_13, it is recommended but not mandatory for a Relying Party to verify whether a PID or attestation is revoked.
VCR_12.searchText: vcr_12 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a relying party decides it needs to be able to verify the revocation status of pids or attestations, it shall support both the attestation status list mechanism and the attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11. per vcr_13, it is recommended but not mandatory for a relying party to verify whether a pid or attestation is revoked.

VCR_12a.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL support both the Attestation Status List mechanism and the Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11 for verifying the revocation status of a WUA.
VCR_12a.searchText: vcr_12a attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider or attestation provider shall support both the attestation status list mechanism and the attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11 for verifying the revocation status of a wua.

VCR_13.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHOULD verify the revocation status of a PID or attestation upon obtaining it from a Wallet Unit, following the steps specified per VCR_11.
VCR_13.searchText: vcr_13 attestation revocation and revocation checking a relying party instance should verify the revocation status of a pid or attestation upon obtaining it from a wallet unit, following the steps specified per vcr_11.

VCR_14.specification: When no reliable information regarding the revocation status of a PID or attestation is available, a Relying Party SHOULD perform a risk analysis considering all relevant factors for the use case, before taking a decision to accept or refuse the PID or attestation.
VCR_14.searchText: vcr_14 attestation revocation and revocation checking when no reliable information regarding the revocation status of a pid or attestation is available, a relying party should perform a risk analysis considering all relevant factors for the use case, before taking a decision to accept or refuse the pid or attestation.

VCR_15.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHOULD NOT request the relevant Attestation Status List or Attestation Revocation List each time an attestation is presented to it by a Wallet Unit. Rather, the Relying Party operating the Relying Party Instance SHOULD download each new version of the list once, at a time and from a location unrelated to the presentation of a PID or attestation by a User. The Relying Party SHOULD then distribute the list to all of its Relying Party Instances, using an Relying Party-internal distribution mechanism.
VCR_15.searchText: vcr_15 attestation revocation and revocation checking a relying party instance should not request the relevant attestation status list or attestation revocation list each time an attestation is presented to it by a wallet unit. rather, the relying party operating the relying party instance should download each new version of the list once, at a time and from a location unrelated to the presentation of a pid or attestation by a user. the relying party should then distribute the list to all of its relying party instances, using an relying party-internal distribution mechanism.

VCR_16.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL NOT require the Relying Party or Relying Party Instance to authenticate itself before downloading an Attestation Status List or Attestation Revocation List.
VCR_16.searchText: vcr_16 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall not require the relying party or relying party instance to authenticate itself before downloading an attestation status list or attestation revocation list.

VCR_17.specification: When using an Attestation Status List for revocation, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL randomly assign the index for each PID or attestation, to prevent this index from becoming a correlator.
VCR_17.notes: Randomly assigning indices within a bitstring or byte array is more complicated than creating random identifiers (e.g. serial numbers) for attestations, as is needed for an Attestation Revocation List. This is because duplicate indices and unnecessarily long bitstrings or byte arrays must be prevented.
VCR_17.searchText: vcr_17 attestation revocation and revocation checking when using an attestation status list for revocation, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall randomly assign the index for each pid or attestation, to prevent this index from becoming a correlator. randomly assigning indices within a bitstring or byte array is more complicated than creating random identifiers (e.g. serial numbers) for attestations, as is needed for an attestation revocation list. this is because duplicate indices and unnecessarily long bitstrings or byte arrays must be prevented.

VCR_18.specification: When using an Attestation Status List for revocation, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL represent a sufficiently large number of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs on each Attestation Status List to ensure herd privacy.
VCR_18.notes: In this context, herd privacy means that if an entity requests a particular status list, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider is not able to deduce which PID, attestation or WUA (likely) was presented to that entity. Complying with this requirement may be difficult in case the number of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs to be represented on the list is small. In such a case, decoy entries can be added to the list to obfuscate the real number of referenced PIDs, attestations, or WUAs.
VCR_18.searchText: vcr_18 attestation revocation and revocation checking when using an attestation status list for revocation, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall represent a sufficiently large number of pids, attestations, or wuas on each attestation status list to ensure herd privacy. in this context, herd privacy means that if an entity requests a particular status list, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider is not able to deduce which pid, attestation or wua (likely) was presented to that entity. complying with this requirement may be difficult in case the number of pids, attestations, or wuas to be represented on the list is small. in such a case, decoy entries can be added to the list to obfuscate the real number of referenced pids, attestations, or wuas.

VCR_19.specification: A Wallet Unit SHOULD regularly check the revocation status of its PIDs, attestations, and WUAs, and notify the User if a PID, attestation, or WUA (i.e, the Wallet Unit itself), is revoked.
VCR_19.searchText: vcr_19 attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet unit should regularly check the revocation status of its pids, attestations, and wuas, and notify the user if a pid, attestation, or wua (i.e, the wallet unit itself), is revoked.

Reg_01.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_01.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_01.specification: Member States SHALL provide processes and mechanisms for PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, non-qualified EAA Providers, and Relying Parties to register in a registry.
Reg_01.notes: Member States may choose to implement a single registry for all these roles, or a separate registry for each of these roles.
Reg_01.searchText: reg_01 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall provide processes and mechanisms for pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, non-qualified eaa providers, and relying parties to register in a registry. member states may choose to implement a single registry for all these roles, or a separate registry for each of these roles.

Reg_01a.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_01a.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_01a.specification: Member States SHALL register a common set of data about a) PID Providers, b) QEAA Providers, c) PuB-EAA Providers, d) non-qualified EAA Providers. and e) Relying Parties, according to the relevant requirements in [Technical Specification 6](../../technical-specifications/ts6-common-set-of-rp-information-to-be-registered.md).
Reg_01a.notes: For PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers, the common set of data specified in [Technical Specification 6] include the attestation type(s) that the provider intends to issue to Wallet Units.
Reg_01a.searchText: reg_01a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall register a common set of data about a) pid providers, b) qeaa providers, c) pub-eaa providers, d) non-qualified eaa providers. and e) relying parties, according to the relevant requirements in [technical specification 6](../../technical-specifications/ts6-common-set-of-rp-information-to-be-registered.md). for pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers, the common set of data specified in [technical specification 6] include the attestation type(s) that the provider intends to issue to wallet units.

Reg_01b.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_01b.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_01b.searchText: reg_01b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_02.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_02.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_02.specification: Member States SHALL make publicly available all necessary details and documentation about the registration processes for their registry.
Reg_02.searchText: reg_02 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall make publicly available all necessary details and documentation about the registration processes for their registry.

Reg_03.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_03.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_03.specification: Member States SHALL publish the registry entries online, in a sealed or signed machine-readable common format suitable for automated processing, according to the relevant requirements in [Technical Specification 5](../../technical-specifications/ts5-common-formats-and-api-for-rp-registration-information.md), for the purpose of transparency to Users and other stakeholders.
Reg_03.searchText: reg_03 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall publish the registry entries online, in a sealed or signed machine-readable common format suitable for automated processing, according to the relevant requirements in [technical specification 5](../../technical-specifications/ts5-common-formats-and-api-for-rp-registration-information.md), for the purpose of transparency to users and other stakeholders.

Reg_04.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_04.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_04.specification: Member States SHALL make the registry entries available online, in a human-readable format. The website used for this purpose SHALL use a secure channel protecting the authenticity and integrity of the information in the registry during transport. Member States SHALL NOT require authentication or prior registration and authorisation of any person wishing to retrieve the information in the registry.
Reg_04.searchText: reg_04 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall make the registry entries available online, in a human-readable format. the website used for this purpose shall use a secure channel protecting the authenticity and integrity of the information in the registry during transport. member states shall not require authentication or prior registration and authorisation of any person wishing to retrieve the information in the registry.

Reg_05.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_05.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_05.searchText: reg_05 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_06.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_06.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_06.specification: Member States SHALL support the common API specified in [Technical Specification 5](../../technical-specifications/ts5-common-formats-and-api-for-rp-registration-information.md) for to enable automated retrieval of registry entries from the Member States' registries.
Reg_06.notes: [Technical Specification 5] specifies the use of a secure channel protecting the authenticity and integrity of the information in the registry during transport, and does not require authentication or prior registration and authorisation of any entity wishing to retrieve the information in the registry.
Reg_06.searchText: reg_06 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall support the common api specified in [technical specification 5](../../technical-specifications/ts5-common-formats-and-api-for-rp-registration-information.md) for to enable automated retrieval of registry entries from the member states' registries. [technical specification 5] specifies the use of a secure channel protecting the authenticity and integrity of the information in the registry during transport, and does not require authentication or prior registration and authorisation of any entity wishing to retrieve the information in the registry.

Reg_07.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_07.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_07.specification: A Member State SHALL enable a registered PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party to update the information registered on it, using a process comparable to the original registration process. For Relying Parties, this SHALL be possible using the API or user interface mentioned in Reg_24.
Reg_07.searchText: reg_07 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall enable a registered pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party to update the information registered on it, using a process comparable to the original registration process. for relying parties, this shall be possible using the api or user interface mentioned in reg_24.

Reg_08.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_08.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_08.specification: A registered PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party SHALL make any updates necessary to ensure the continued correctness of the registered information without undue delay.
Reg_08.searchText: reg_08 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registered pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party shall make any updates necessary to ensure the continued correctness of the registered information without undue delay.

Reg_09.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_09.subsection: A. General requirements for Member State registration processes
Reg_09.specification: Member States SHALL log all changes made on the information registered regarding a PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, including at least initial registration, updates, deletion of information, and suspension or cancellation.
Reg_09.searchText: reg_09 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties member states shall log all changes made on the information registered regarding a pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, including at least initial registration, updates, deletion of information, and suspension or cancellation.

Reg_10.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_10.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_10.specification: A Member State SHALL ensure that an Access Certificate Authority notified according to [[Topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)] issues an access certificate to all PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, non-qualified EAA Providers, and Relying Parties registered in one of the Member State's registries.
Reg_10.searchText: reg_10 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall ensure that an access certificate authority notified according to [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)] issues an access certificate to all pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, non-qualified eaa providers, and relying parties registered in one of the member state's registries.

Reg_11.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_11.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_11.specification: A Member State SHALL ensure that the issuance process of access certificates by their notified Access Certificate Authority(s) complies with a common Certificate Policy for Access Certificate Authority.
Reg_11.searchText: reg_11 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall ensure that the issuance process of access certificates by their notified access certificate authority(s) complies with a common certificate policy for access certificate authority.

Reg_12.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_12.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_12.specification: The Commission SHALL provide technical specifications establishing the common Access Certificate Authority Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_11.
Reg_12.searchText: reg_12 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the commission shall provide technical specifications establishing the common access certificate authority certificate policy mentioned in reg_11.

Reg_13.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_13.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_13.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an Access Certificate Authority logs all issued access certificates for Certificate Transparency (CT), according to all requirements in [Topic 55](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2333-topic-55---certificate-transparency).
Reg_13.searchText: reg_13 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate authority logs all issued access certificates for certificate transparency (ct), according to all requirements in [topic 55](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2333-topic-55---certificate-transparency).

Reg_14.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_14.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_14.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an Access Certificate Authority provides one or more method(s) to revoke the access certificates it issued.
Reg_14.searchText: reg_14 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate authority provides one or more method(s) to revoke the access certificates it issued.

Reg_15.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_15.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_15.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL include a policy for revocation, which SHALL require that an Access Certificate Authority revokes an access certificate at least when: - the certificate subject which is a Relying Party is suspended or cancelled by the respective Registrar, - the certificate subject which is a PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, or non-qualified EAA Provider is suspended or cancelled by the respective Registrar, - on request of the certificate subject, or - on request of a competent national authority.
Reg_15.searchText: reg_15 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall include a policy for revocation, which shall require that an access certificate authority revokes an access certificate at least when: - the certificate subject which is a relying party is suspended or cancelled by the respective registrar, - the certificate subject which is a pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, or non-qualified eaa provider is suspended or cancelled by the respective registrar, - on request of the certificate subject, or - on request of a competent national authority.

Reg_16.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_16.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_16.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL specify the profile of access certificates in detail.
Reg_16.searchText: reg_16 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall specify the profile of access certificates in detail.

Reg_17.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_17.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_17.searchText: reg_17 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_18.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_18.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_18.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL define the minimum change history information to be stored for resolving possible disputes regarding registration.
Reg_18.searchText: reg_18 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall define the minimum change history information to be stored for resolving possible disputes regarding registration.

Reg_19.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_19.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_19.specification: A Member State SHALL approve a PID Provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its PID Provider Registry. To that end, a Member State SHALL define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of PID Providers in its Registry.
Reg_19.searchText: reg_19 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall approve a pid provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its pid provider registry. to that end, a member state shall define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of pid providers in its registry.

Reg_20.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_20.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_20.specification: A Member State SHALL identify PID Providers at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent PID Provider could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
Reg_20.searchText: reg_20 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify pid providers at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent pid provider could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

Reg_20a.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_20a.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_20a.specification: A Registrar SHALL provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered PID Provider.
Reg_20a.searchText: reg_20a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered pid provider.

Reg_20b.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_20b.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_20b.specification: A Registrar SHALL have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered PID Provider, which SHALL specify that a PID Provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the PID Provider or of a competent national authority.
Reg_20b.searchText: reg_20b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered pid provider, which shall specify that a pid provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the pid provider or of a competent national authority.

Reg_21.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_21.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_21.specification: A Member State SHALL approve an Attestation Provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its Attestation Provider Registry. To that end, a Member State SHALL define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of Attestation Providers in its Registry. These processes and rules SHOULD consider any relevant differences between QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers.
Reg_21.searchText: reg_21 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall approve an attestation provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its attestation provider registry. to that end, a member state shall define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of attestation providers in its registry. these processes and rules should consider any relevant differences between qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers.

Reg_22.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_22.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_22.specification: A Member State SHALL identify Attestation Providers (i.e., QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers and non-qualified EAA Providers) at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent Attestation Provider could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
Reg_22.searchText: reg_22 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify attestation providers (i.e., qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers and non-qualified eaa providers) at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent attestation provider could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

Reg_22a.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_22a.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_22a.specification: A Registrar SHALL provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered Attestation Provider.
Reg_22a.searchText: reg_22a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered attestation provider.

Reg_22b.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_22b.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_22b.specification: A Registrar SHALL have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered Attestation Provider, which SHALL specify that an Attestation Provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the Attestation Provider or of a competent national authority.
Reg_22b.searchText: reg_22b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered attestation provider, which shall specify that an attestation provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the attestation provider or of a competent national authority.

Reg_23.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_23.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties

Reg_24.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_24.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_24.specification: A Member State SHALL enable a Relying Party to register remotely, using an API or user interface.
Reg_24.searchText: reg_24 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall enable a relying party to register remotely, using an api or user interface.

Reg_25.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_25.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_25.specification: A Member State SHALL identify a Relying Party at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent Relying Party could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
Reg_25.searchText: reg_25 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify a relying party at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent relying party could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

Reg_26.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_26.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_26.specification: With respect to Reg_25, a Member State SHALL consider whether a registering entity intends to act as an intermediary.
Reg_26.notes: According to the [European Digital Identity Regulation], an intermediary is a Relying Party.
Reg_26.searchText: reg_26 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties with respect to reg_25, a member state shall consider whether a registering entity intends to act as an intermediary. according to the [european digital identity regulation], an intermediary is a relying party.

Reg_29.specification: A Member State SHALL have a policy for the cancellation of a registered Relying Party, which SHALL specify that a Relying Party is cancelled at least on request of the Relying Party or of a competent national authority.

Reg_30.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties

Reg_31.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_31.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
Reg_31.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an access certificate contains a name for the PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, in a format suitable for presenting to a User.
Reg_31.searchText: reg_31 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate contains a name for the pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, in a format suitable for presenting to a user.

Reg_32.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_32.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
Reg_32.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an access certificate contains an EU-wide unique identifier for the PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, and SHALL specify a method for deriving such identifiers.
Reg_32.notes: a) The EU-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a composition of a unique identifier of the Registrar, defined in the policy, and a unique identifier for the Relying Party allocated by this Registrar. b) This Relying Party identifier is identical in all access certificates issued to a given entity.
Reg_32.searchText: reg_32 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate contains an eu-wide unique identifier for the pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, and shall specify a method for deriving such identifiers. a) the eu-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a composition of a unique identifier of the registrar, defined in the policy, and a unique identifier for the relying party allocated by this registrar. b) this relying party identifier is identical in all access certificates issued to a given entity.

Reg_33.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_33.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
Reg_33.searchText: reg_33 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

RPRC_01.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
RPRC_01.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
RPRC_01.specification: The Commission SHALL provide a technical specification establishing a common Certificate Policy for registration certificates, covering at least management and selection of signing keys, revocation and lifecycle management of registration certificates on individual intended use level.
RPRC_01.notes: The technical specification may require the Provider of registration certificates to follow applicable parts of technical standards such as EN 319 401 (for General Policy Requirements for TSPs) and TS 119 461 (for identity proofing of Relying Party representatives).
RPRC_01.searchText: rprc_01 registration certificates for pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the commission shall provide a technical specification establishing a common certificate policy for registration certificates, covering at least management and selection of signing keys, revocation and lifecycle management of registration certificates on individual intended use level. the technical specification may require the provider of registration certificates to follow applicable parts of technical standards such as en 319 401 (for general policy requirements for tsps) and ts 119 461 (for identity proofing of relying party representatives).

RPRC_02.topicTitle: Registration certificates for PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
RPRC_02.subsection: A. Generic requirements on the specification and contents of registration certificates
RPRC_02.specification: The Commission SHALL ensure that a technical specification is created, describing at least 1. the contents and format of registration certificates for Relying Parties, see the other requirements in this section below. 2. the signing method(s) used to ensure the authenticity of the registration certificate. 3. the trust infrastructure necessary for signing registration certificates and for verifying these signatures, including the use of Trusted Lists to establish trust in Providers of registration certificates and to distribute their trust anchors to Wallet Units. 4. the method used for binding each registration certificate to the access certificate that will be used in the same presentation request. This binding method SHALL enable a Wallet Unit to verify that the registration certificate is bound to the entity that authenticated itself using the access certificate.
